summary: This document is an email chain from January 2020 between DOJ OIG and BOP officials discussing the Federal Bureau of Prisons' plan to convene a Board of Inquiry to review operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, specifically in relation to the Epstein case and his death there. The correspondence coordinates input from the FBI and U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: BOP Plans Board of Inquiry for MCC NY
events.description: The Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) Office of Internal Affairs informs the DOJ OIG that it plans to convene a Board of Inquiry to review operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The review will examine local policy/procedures for special housing, camera operations, training, and staffing, specifically in the context of the Epstein/MCC case.

locations: One Battery Park Plaza, 29th Floor, New York, NY 10004 (DOJ OIG NY Field Office)
320 First Street, N.W., Room 600, Washington, D.C. 20534 (BOP Office of Internal Affairs)
keyFacts: The Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) planned a Board of Inquiry to review operations at MCC New York in January 2020, directly linked to the 'Epstein/MCC case'.
The review was explicitly not a misconduct investigation but would examine special housing procedures, camera operations, training, and staffing.
The BOP stated it would 'studiously avoid' creating conflict with the ongoing criminal investigation related to Epstein.
The DOJ OIG was coordinating to get formal positions on this inquiry from both the FBI and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
The email chain shows high-level inter-agency coordination (DOJ OIG, BOP OIA, FBI, USAO SDNY) following Epstein's death in custody.
